<div id="data_types" class="registered_link"></div>

The following table shows the built-in general-purpose data types to support Oracle compatibile data type. Few data types listed below are also an alias to Postgres data types:

| Name                               | Alias                                               | Description                                                                       |
| ---------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `BLOB,LONG RAW, RAW(n)`            | `BYTEA`                                             | Binary data                                                                       |
| `BOOLEAN`                          |                                                     | Logical Boolean (true/false)                                                      |
| `CHAR [ (n) ]`                     | `CHARACTER [ (n) ]`                                 | Fixed-length character string of `n` characters                                   |
| `CLOB`                             |                                                     | Long character string                                                             |
| `LONG, LONG VARCHAR`               | `TEXT`                                              | Long character string
| `DATE`                             | `TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE`                       | Date and time to the second                                                       |
| `DOUBLE PRECISION`                 | `FLOAT, FLOAT(25) – FLOAT(53)`                      | Double precision floating-point number                                            |
| `INTEGER`                          | `INT`                                               | Signed four-byte integer                                                          |
| `BINARY_INTEGER, PLS_INTEGER`      | `INTEGER`                                           |
| `NUMBER, NUMBER(p [, s ])`         | `NUMERIC`                                           | Exact numeric with optional decimal places                                        |
| `REAL`                             | `FLOAT(1) – FLOAT(24)`                              | Single-precision floating-point number                                            |
| `TIMESTAMP [ (p) ]`                |                                                     | Date and time with optional, fractional second precision, `p`                     |
| `TIMESTAMP [ (p) ] WITH TIME ZONE` |                                                     | Date and time with optional, fractional second precision, `p`, and with time zone |
| `VARCHAR2(n)`                      | `CHARACTER VARYING(n)`                              | Variable-length character string with a maximum length of `n` characters          |
| `XMLTYPE`                          |                                                     | XML data                                                                          |


To see more information about Postgres data types mentioned in `Alias` column see [data types](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype.html).
<div class="toctree" maxdepth="3">

numeric_types character_types binary_data date_time_types boolean_type xml_type

</div>
